Class Coordinate Transformation

Kernel ANSI C collection of different pixel coordinate transformation algorithms, last updated 10/18/1999 by edr@mip.sdu.dk. More...

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C collection of different pixel coordinate transformation algorithms, last updated 10/18/1999 by edr@mip.sdu.dk.

These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.10
Author:
Ivar Balslev ivb@mip.sdu.dk

Function Documentation

bool k_ScaleAndRotateAuto (  TImage *    pSource,
TImage *    pDest,
double    Sx,
double    Sy,
double    phi,
UINT32    Background
) 
 

Performes a scaling given by (Sx,Sy) and a rotation through the angle phi.

Automatic sizing is used, i.e. adjustment to the minimum size allowing the full image to be included. Works on 24 b/p images and graytone images with 1,4 or 8 b/p. If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same pointer for both parameters "pSource" and "pDest". Note: When "pSource" and "pDest" points to same image the function is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). If the provided source image has no border, the function uses the "Background" parameter to add a temporary background with the given value to do interpolation at edge-pixels fast. Adds a line to the history of pDest.

Parameters:
pSource  Source image to scale.
pDest  Destination image, may be same as source image.
Sx  Scaling in x-direction.
Sy  Scaling in y-direction.
phi  Rotation in radians.
Background  If source image has no border, a temporary border with this value is added to the source image. Note: If the source image has a border the function uses the pixel values in this border to interpolate edge pixels.
Returns :
False if source image is empty.

References TImage::Bits, TImage::BorderSize, TImage::FileInfo, FLOAT32, TImage::Height, TImage::History, k_AddFileAndLine, k_AllocImage(), k_AppendTextIPL(), k_CopyFileInfo(), k_CopyImage(), k_CopyPalette(), k_CopyText(), k_EmptyImage(), k_EmptyString(), k_GetColorInterpolatedFast(), k_GetPixelInterpolatedFast(), k_InitImage(), k_InitString(), k_IplStartHistoryMacro, k_IplStopHistoryMacro, k_SetBorder(), k_SetBorderSize(), k_SetPixel1bp, k_SetPixel24bp, k_SetPixel8bp, k_ShowMessage(), k_SprintfString(), TImage::Origin, TImage::Pal, TString::pChars, UINT32, and TImage::Width.

bool k_ScaleAndRotateFixed (  TImage *    pSource,
TImage *    pDest,
double    x0,
double    y0,
int    Width,
int    Height,
double    Sx,
double    Sy,
double    phi,
UINT32    Background
) 
 

Makes an image with dimensions (Width * Height) and unchanged bits per pixel.

Performs a scaling (Sx,Sy) and a rotation through the angle phi. The position (x0,y0) of the old image is placed at (Width/2,Height/2) in the new. Works on 24 b/p images and graytone images with 1,4 or 8 b/p. If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same pointer for both parameters "pSource" and "pDest". Note: When "pSource" and "pDest" points to same image the function is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). If the provided source image has no border, the function uses the "Background" parameter to add a temporary background with the given value to do interpolation at edge-pixels fast. Adds a line to the history of pDest.

Parameters:
pSource  Source image to scale.
pDest  Destination image, may be same as source image.
x0  Horisontal position from old image placed at Width/2 in new image.
y0  Vertical position from old image placed at Height/2 in new image.
Width  Size in horisontal direction of new image.
Height  Size in vertical direction of new image.
Sx  Scaling in x-direction.
Sy  Scaling in y-direction.
phi  Rotation in radians.
Background  If source image has no border, a temporary border with this value is added to the source image. Note: If the source image has a border the function uses the pixel values in this border to interpolate edge pixels.
Returns :
False if source image is empty.

bool k_ScaleAuto (  TImage *    pSource,
TImage *    pDest,
double    Sx,
double    Sy,
UINT32    Background
) 
 

Performs a scaling using the scale factors (Sx,Sy) and autosizing of the new image placed in "pDest".

Works on 24 b/p images and graytone images with 1,4 or 8 b/p. If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same pointer for both parameters "pSource" and "pDest". Note: When "pSource" and "pDest" points to same image the function is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). If the provided source image has no border, the function uses the "Background" parameter to add a temporary background with the given value to do interpolation at edge-pixels fast. Adds a line to the history of pDest.

Parameters:
pSource  Source image to scale.
pDest  Destination image, may be same as source image.
Sx  Scaling in x-direction.
Sy  Scaling in y-direction.
Background  If source image has no border, a temporary border with this value is added to the source image. Note: If the source image has a border the function uses the pixel values in this border to interpolate edge pixels.
Returns :
False if source image is empty.

If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same pointer for both parameters "pSource" and "pDest".
